action: I want to quickly and accurately search for necessary information from large volumes of business data
reason: Because immediate access to data is critical for maintaining business efficiency
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users to access the search functionality.
The system must enforce row-level access control to restrict data visibility based on the user's role.
The system shall support multi-field search capabilities including Name, ID, Email, Date, and Status.
The system must support partial match (LIKE), exact match, numeric range, and date range search queries.
The system shall allow users to combine multiple search conditions using logical AND and OR operators.
The system must provide sorting functionality and pagination with a configurable limit per page (e.g., max 100 items).
The system shall prevent unrestricted full-table retrieval if specific search criteria are missing.
The system must use parameterized queries for all database interactions to prevent SQL injection.
The system shall sanitize all input values to protect against Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks.
The system must utilize database indexing on key fields to ensure performance with over 1 million records.
The system shall target an API response time of under 500ms for standard search queries.
The system must enforce rate limiting and restrict wildcard usage to prevent Denial of Service (DoS) and high load.
The system shall implement caching for identical queries, ensuring the cache is invalidated upon data update.
The system must generate an immutable audit log for every search operation, capturing User ID, criteria, and timestamp.
The system shall return an HTTP 400 error for invalid parameters and must not expose internal database error details.
The system must be designed to facilitate future integration with dedicated full-text search engines.
The search API must adhere to REST principles and return responses in JSON format encoded in UTF-8.
